reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sayeban Hotel is a new and recent hotel (it opened in February 2012), managed by a young staff, located at the old part of the historic district of Sultanhamet. It's first asset is the location,. situated 10 minutes from all the main historic attractions (the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, the Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace and so many other places). The neighbourhood is typically popular and full of life, in the oldest part of the district (which for us was a plus, since we love popular atmospheres!). The decoration is simple but with great taste, bedroom was clean, comfortable and adequate, though we know there are even better rooms (so next time we'll choose them!).When the weather is nice, breakfast is served on the terrace overlooking the sea and the old neighbourhood, and consists of a varied buffet which includes some of the local food. The price/quality relation is thus great. If this did not suffice, the hotel's main asset is it's wonderful staff, which consists of young people in general, all included, but especially Fatih and Ali, who speak good English, and have truly made our stay unforgettable. They provide you with all necessary information of where to go, what to see, even where to have a nice meal, and always in the kindest and gentlest way. They were really excellent! The hotel can only improve with time, and apart from one or two details, it is a wonderful place, given all these features. It really contributed to making our stay truly unforgettable and also for the love we felt for Instanbul ont the day we left.A truly great place!
reviews.title: A most wonderful stay and a most wonderful staff!

reviews.text: It's a new hotel with a great location. The design is excellent - it's not a "Resort" type property, but the rates are reasonable. The rooms are not large, but seem large due to the good modern design. There is a good convienience store just across the street for bottled water with a large stock of fresh bread - great baguets. The hotel is family owned and operated - and the family cares about your experience - their service is great. The view from the 6th floor breakfast area is not to be missed. The breakfast is good with a nice variety - and attentive service. Internet service is strong - with antennas for each floor - you can pick from 1-6 for the strongest signal. The satellite TV service is good, but the 2 remote controls are a bit difficult to figure out. There are international channels, but most are Turkish. Good value for the stay. Check it out for yourself.
reviews.title: Family Run Hotel with great Aminities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband spent 4 nights in Sayeban hotel. It's a brand new hotel, well located, very clean and with friendly staff. Hotel is located 5 minutes away (on foot) from the Grand Bazaar, and about 10 minutes walk away from Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Basically, you can see all the main attractions on foot. Rooms are rather small, but have everything you might need, you can have a good night sleep (beds are very comfortable, and area is rather quiet during night) and breakfast is excellent. Hotel is rather small, but that's very good, because there isn't much of a crowd during breakfast time and you feel very safe, since you get to know pretty much all of the guests. Ali and Fatih, staff members, are very willing to help and you can ask them anything.
reviews.title: Let's go to Istanbul!

reviews.text: I strongly recommend this Hotel to everyone who want to visit this amazing city!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel,Friendly Staff,Strongly Recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Safdar Ali USA
reviews.title: Friendly staff, nice hotel

reviews.text: we stayed this hotel because of good review within tripadvisor. when we got a taxi from the airport, local taxi driver did not know so i was aware they must be reasonably new in business. the area where the hotel located was opposite side to grandbazzar from tram - so at night the area looked a bit dodgy (again in the end it was not dodgy at all - it just looked like that as our first impression) when we checked in we were welcomed by young cheerful staff who offered us with porter service. the reception looked a bit empty (they can make it more cozy and appealing) but when we got to the room, the room was spacious, clean and very well modernised. bathroom fitting was brandnew (so does my friends room) and i am very pleasantly surprised and pleased. internet was very fast too - it was indeed very good value for money. breakfast was even better - wider selection of cooked foods (which is rare in turkey as their standard breakfast consists of bread cheese olives cucumber tomato and melon or watermelon. some places you get sausages or boiled egg and that is it ) and the staff was friendly and polite throughout our stay. apart from location being a bit of walking distant from tram (well still maybe only 10-12 mim walk so not too bad if you are not dragging suitcases) the hotel has almost everything you look for with good price.
reviews.title: rooms are well renovated and modernised - very comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended by my sister who stayed here earlier this year. We ordered an airport transfer through the hotel but this took us to the wrong airport and we missed our flights. We returned to the hotel and they gave us a FREE ROOM AND PAID FOR SOME NEW FLIGHTS !!!!!!
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time in Istanbul, the hotel accommodation excellent, The location is within walking distance to the Blue mosque and the other major attractions. We will be returning again soon with my son.
reviews.title: Second time at the hotel, and again a wonderful stay!

reviews.text: Stayed in August this year.
reviews.title: Sayeban brings you near the real Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had stayed at the Sayeban in May 2012, and returned for a second holiday in July. And again we loved it all. Everything is great about it, the bedrooms are nice and have enough room for our suitcases, and the terrace where breakfast is served when the weather is fine has been improved, with new benches, making it ever more pleasant. And again, like in May, the staff, Ali, Fatih, Muhammad and the others were extremely kind and gentle, providing again for a second and very pleasant stay. We brought two new guests, acquaintances we had made during our second trip to Turkey, and they were also pleased with everyhting. There are bigger and smaller rooms, with different prices, but the quality/price relationship is really great. In the last day we had to leave earlier for the airport, and the staff went to extremes to provide a nice breakfast before we left, opening the buffet earlier than usual. And for those who love typical atmospheres, the hotel's location, right in the middle of the neighbourhood of Sultanhamet, renders the whole stay authentic and incredible. We will never forget it and we will surely be back some day!
reviews.title: great boutique hotel

reviews.text: Stayed there in the beginning of this June - absolutely loved it. The location is nice for real travellers: those who know how to appreciate not only touristic sights but the very local culture itself as well. Grand Bazaar and a tram station are situated about 10 mins of walking up the hill, so don't put on high heels if unaccustomed to walk in them on the old pavement =) Right around the hotel are several small shops (actually, they seem to be everywhere in this marvellous city), some local businesses, and, of course, a lot of people, but not as much traffic, as the streets are pretty narrow. Thus, it is pretty quiet, as the hotel is not right by the main tourist attractions, and I always consider such location a remarkable advantage. In any case, I slept like a baby due to recieving so many immense impressions from the city during the day ))
reviews.title: Amazing experience worth repeating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sayeban hotel is a brand new one, so take the chance while it is shining with polish. Though, as it is a family partnership, so to say, the owners do take good care of the business, so I bet it will bring satisfaction to guests for a very long time.
reviews.title: Exceptionally good value for your money and great service

reviews.text: As I saw mentioned in reviews, yes, there is Wi-Fi (actually, a separate modem for each floor what I find very nice of the owners to do). Breakfast takes place on the terrace (if the weather is cold - in the room next to the lobby area) with a breathtaking view of the sea, a church (or a cathedral) right by the hotel, and the quieter part of the city itself.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff of the hotel are the most pleasant people I've seen in services rendering business. Besides Turkish, obviously, at Reception they speak German, English, and that's only what I heard. Everyone is polite and always ready to help with the itinerary, to give advice on how to get to touristic or not sights, where to go for shopping, dining, clubbing, etc. Taxis are available in a couple of minutes tops. Overall service is outstanding and, in my opinion, with such people on board, it will only get better with the time.
reviews.title: great new hotel
strongly recommended
reviews.text: I'd recomment this hotel to any type of travellers: business, or family, company of friends or solo - this place will provide you with everything possible you may need to rest after or during exploring the splendid city of Istanbul!
This was my first stay at a local hotel in lieu of the Big Chain Hotels that I've normally stayed at in Istanbul.
reviews.title: Great value and perfect location!

reviews.text: The location was great and close to every historical site by foot, tram or train. The staff was very cordial and helpful with every request especially Ali and Yasuz. Complimentary WiFi was perfect as well as the complimentary Breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Good location- modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: See you next year or sooner!
reviews.title: A real feel of Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ed and Scott
reviews.title: Pleasant stay while in Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sayeban for one week and enjoyed our time here. Admittedly we spent very little time in our rooms except to sleep as there is so much to do in Istanbul to keep you occupied during the day, but we had a good night's sleep each night. I would imagine however that in the summer when you want to sleep with the window open it might get quite noisy. It was perfect and cosy in December.
reviews.title: Be careful!
